hero.title: AHS Water Assassins 2026 (unaffiliated)
hero.description: I'm still working on this so ignore everything here.

how.title: How It Works
how.description: Create an account and join a team.

first.title: Sign In
first.description: Create an account and set up your profile.

second.title: Make A Team
second.description: Get into a group of 2-5 people.

third.title: Sign In
third.description: The team leader pays through Stripe.

bounties.title: Bounties (1/2 Player Fee)
bounties.description: Get paid $5 each week for killing your target and suriving to claim their bounty.

prize.title: Grand Prize (1/2 Player Fee)
prize.description: The winning team claims the full Grand Prize, split between the members.

1.question: How much does it cost
1.answer: The registration fee per team is $10. Each player costs $25, with the Player Fee split between the Bounty program and the Grand Prize.

2.question: Can I make my money back without winning the Grand Prize?
2.answer: Yes. As teams are eliminated, the bounty per kill increases.

3.question: How many rounds will there be?

4.question: What if my friend group can't evenly divide into teams of 5?
4.answer: You can register as a smaller team, and later decide to merge or add new members.

5.question: What are the boundries and protected areas?
5.answer: You are safe while on school property (including street parking, sidewalks, and any road that touches school property, extended up to one intersection). Any sports or other school activites extend these same rules to the new location during the time of the activity.

6.question: What dates will Water Assassins run?
6.answer: The five week game will start on President's Day, February 16th. It will conclude on March 20th, over a week before Spring Break starts.

7.question: What are the requirements to confirm a kill?
7.answer: All water guns must be clearly marked (add an orange tip if it looks real). You can use a hose, bucket, your hands, anything where the water passes through your hands or something you are holding. After calling a hit, you need to stop shooting, and get a picture with your target, showing the water on them. A video of you hitting them is also required.

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.description: Welcome to our service. By using our website, you agree to comply with the following terms and conditions.

policy.title: Privacy Policy
policy.description: We value your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your data.

collection.title: Data Collection
collection.description: We may collect personal information such as your name, email address, and usage data to improve our service and provide a better user experience.

security.title: Data Security
security.description: We implement a variety of security measures to ensure the safety of your personal data. However, no method of transmission over the internet is completely secure, so we cannot guarantee absolute security.

changes.title: Changes to this Policy
changes.description: We may update this Terms and Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated date.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: If you have any questions about these terms or our privacy policy, feel free to contact us.

signin.title: Sign In
signin.description: Make sure to use your school email to sign in.

signup.title: Sign In
signup.description: Make sure to use your school email to sign in.
